text: The Fergana peach, Prunus ferganensis, is either a species or a landrace of peach (Prunus persica), depending on the authority believed. P.ferganensis is found growing in, and takes its name from, the Fergana Valley of Central Asia. It differs from other domesticated peaches in having smaller fruit with no red blush, a groove in the pit, and unbranched leaf veins. In spite of these morphological differences, genetically P.ferganensis is deeply embedded within the domestic peach lineage. ==References== ferganensis Category:Peaches Category:Fruits originating in Asia Category:Flora of Central Asia Category:Plants described in 1932
title: Fergana peach
